etymology.description: 立(立) (lì, 'stand') + 立(立) (lì, 'stand') = things standing together -> combine
etymology.interpretation: The character 並(並) (bìng, 'combine') uses two 立(立) (lì, 'stand') components to convey the idea of standing together, symbolizing the notion of combining or aligning multiple things.
etymology.simplification: 并 is the simplified form of 並 by omitting the repetition of 立(立) (lì, 'stand'), and simplifying the structure to depict a more straightforward shape.

examples.chinese: 他把红茶和牛奶并调制(他把紅茶和牛奶並調製)，制成了一杯奶茶(製成了一杯奶茶)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ hóngchá hé niúnǎi bìng tiáozhì, zhìchéngle yī bēi nǎichá.
examples.english: He mixes red tea and milk to make a cup of milk tea.

examples.chinese: 我们可以把不同的材料并组合(我們可以把不同的材料並組合)，创造出新的风味(創造出新的風味)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen kěyǐ bǎ bùtóng de cáiliào bìng zǔhé, chuàngzào chū xīn de fēngwèi.
examples.english: We can combine different ingredients to create a new flavor.
